channel.title: How to run jdk6 on Windows
channel.description:
I notice lots of newer people want to make there own server but can't compile because they need to have jdk6 well I am here to help.
•~*~•~*~•~*~•~*~•~*~•~*~•~*~•~*~•~*~•~*~•~*~•~*~•~*~•~*~•~*~•~*~•~*~•~*~•~*~•~*~•~*~•~*~•~*~•~*~•
Tutorial Created By: Da 0wnz
1. Go to http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp and download JDK 6 Update 3.
2. Make a new folder on your desktop (or where ever you want to put it) and name it javaJDK.6.update3
3. Install the program.
4. Go to your control panel.
5. Go to Performence and Maintenence.
6. Go to the bottom and you will find "System" click it.
7. Click the Advanced tab.
8. Click Enviornmental Values.
9. You should now find a line that says CLASSPATH click it and then click edit.
10. Change the Variable Value to C:Program FilesJavajdk1.6.0_03in;%CLASSPATH%;
11. Go to the line that says Path click it and then click edit.
12. Change the Variable Value to C:Program FilesJavajdk1.6.0_03in;C:Program FilesJavajre1.6.0_03in
DO NOT CHANGE THE VARIABLE NAMES!
13. Now click OK in Enviornmental Values.
14. Now click OK in System Properties.
15. Now X out of Control Panel.
16. Now you should be able to do what ever you needed to do with JDK 6.
[center]HOPE I HELPED![/center] [center][img]http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/Themes/default/images/warnwarn.gif[/img] The Server Development/Help section is strictly for the server, this means no discussion about the client, trouble with compiling in general, and anything other than the development of servers and otherwise.[/center]

item.title: How to run jdk6 on Windows
item.dc:creator: @Da_0wnz Da 0wnz
item.description:
@Da_0wnz wrote:

I notice lots of newer people want to make there own server but can’t compile because they need to have jdk6 well I am here to help.

•~~•~~•~~•~~•~~•~~•~~•~~•~~•~~•~~•~~•~~•~~•~~•~~•~~•~~•~~•~~•~~•~~•~~•~~•

Tutorial Created By: Da 0wnz

  1. Go to http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp and download JDK 6 Update 3.

  2. Make a new folder on your desktop (or where ever you want to put it) and name it javaJDK.6.update3

  3. Install the program.

  4. Go to your control panel.

  5. Go to Performence and Maintenence.

  6. Go to the bottom and you will find “System” click it.

  7. Click the Advanced tab.

  8. Click Enviornmental Values.

  9. You should now find a line that says CLASSPATH click it and then click edit.

  10. Change the Variable Value to C:Program FilesJavajdk1.6.0_03in;%CLASSPATH%;

  11. Go to the line that says Path click it and then click edit.

  12. Change the Variable Value to C:Program FilesJavajdk1.6.0_03in;C:Program FilesJavajre1.6.0_03in

DO NOT CHANGE THE VARIABLE NAMES!

  1. Now click OK in Enviornmental Values.

  2. Now click OK in System Properties.

  3. Now X out of Control Panel.

  4. Now you should be able to do what ever you needed to do with JDK 6.

[center]HOPE I HELPED![/center]
[center] The Server Development/Help section is strictly for the server, this means no discussion about the client, trouble with compiling in general, and anything other than the development of servers and otherwise.[/center]

Read full topic
item.source: How to run jdk6 on Windows
